input.description: Type of Automation host eg. BSA, BNA, BDA.
Unique Identification for the source which is creating change requests
Numeric ID of the job.
Schedule ID of the schedule for a given job for which approval is required.
Job type.
Job name of the job for which this process has been invoked.
Description for the job as entered by the operator.
Detailed description.
List of Reconciliation IDs of each CI to be associated with the Task.
List of CI Names of each CI to be associated with the Task.
Extra notes about the change
Priority/Urgency
impact.
Type of Change
Start date
End date
User who executes or schedules the job
Status of Job.
Change ID assigned to the job.
Task ID assigned to the job.

output.value: Request is not accepted by AO.

documentation.description: Input received from Automation systems, may have special character that would need to be escaped and timestamp needs to be translated to epoch for Remedy's consumption.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <statements> <statement> <query> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${query}</xsl:text> </query> <parameter-sets> <parameter-set> <parameter> <data-type> <xsl:value-of select="'${datatype}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </data-type> <value> <xsl:value-of select="'${inputParams}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </value> </parameter> </parameter-set> </parameter-sets> </statement> </statements> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

output.value: Request is not accepted by AO due to failure in DB operation.

documentation.description: This interface is built to accept parameters from Automation systems that want to create change request or update change request. Received input is stored within a configured DB. Once request is persisted, response is sent back to Automation systems.
